author: nishant0
content:
This also might help explaining the reasons UDP was used
https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/master/discv5/discv5-rationale.md#why-udp

> Node discovery can tolerate some packet loss. This means that ping, pong, find_node, or nodes packets may be lost, and it is said in specs that the sender should not resend the request. This seems like an added painâ€”why wouldn't we want reliable data transfer?

Being able to tolerate packet loss is a good thing, especially in the context of building your internal peer table quickly. It would give nodes the ability to function in the event of bad connectivity or allow implementations to throttle excessive inbound traffic.    The purpose of discovery isn't to be relaying real-time data, so packet loss isn't a big deal here.
